payload.message: Get the weather report for Revelstoke, British Columbia, Canada. Send it as a text message AND also generate a voice audio file using Piper TTS with the Jenny Dioco voice (/home/ubuntu/.local/share/piper/voices/en/en_GB/jenny_dioco/medium/en_GB-jenny_dioco-medium.onnx) and attach both to the message using the message tool to send to telegram:5083035103.

Get the current weather report for Revelstoke, British Columbia, Canada. Send it as a text message AND generate a voice audio file using Piper TTS with Jenny Dioco voice (/home/ubuntu/.local/share/piper/voices/en/en_GB/jenny_dioco/medium/en_GB-jenny_dioco-medium.onnx) and attach both to the message using the message tool to send to telegram:5083035103.

DREAMMODE NIGHT PHASE:

1. Get yesterday's date (the day before today)

2. CHECK FOR EMERGENCY SNAPSHOTS:
   - List all files in memory/raw/emergency-YYYY-MM-DD-*.md for yesterday
   - If emergency snapshots exist: Read and merge them into memory/raw/YYYY-MM-DD.md
   - Add section to daily file: "## Emergency Snapshots Merged"
   - List times and brief summary of each emergency snapshot

3. Read memory/raw/YYYY-MM-DD.md for yesterday (now includes merged emergency snapshots)

4. Analyze the conversations and extract:
   - Important decisions made
   - New preferences learned about KaMaeron-Tau
   - System changes or configurations
   - Patterns or insights noticed
   - Noise/chatter to delete
   - Incomplete tasks or "later" items (task continuity)
   - Items from emergency snapshots (mark as "from emergency snapshot")
   - Apply tags from tagging schema (memory/metadata/tagging-schema.md)

5. Read ~/.openclaw/dreammode/pattern-learning.json if it exists to improve extraction accuracy

6. Create file: ~/.openclaw/dreammode/dream-candidates-YYYY-MM-DD.md (use yesterday's date)

7. Write extracted items to that file in this format:
   # Dreammode Candidates - [Date]
   
   ## Extracted Items
   1. [Item description] [tags: #type #topic]
   2. [Item description] [tags: #type #topic]
   
   ## Emergency Snapshot Items
   - [Item] (from snapshot at HH:MM) [tags: #type]
   
   ## Incomplete Tasks / Follow-ups
   - [Task] - [Context if any] [tags: #task #status]
   
   ## Noise to Delete
   - [Item]
   
   ## Patterns Noticed
   - [Pattern] [tags: #pattern]

8. AUTO-UPDATE INDEX:
   - Read memory/index.md
   - Add new entries to appropriate sections:
     - New preferences â†’ Add to ## Preferences section
     - New patterns â†’ Add to ## Patterns section
     - New projects â†’ Add to ## Projects section
     - New system configs â†’ Add to ## System Config section
   - Format: "**[Date]** - [Brief description] â†’ [File reference]"
   - Keep index concise (quick reference only)
   - Update "Last Updated" timestamp

9. Update ~/.openclaw/dreammode/dream-state.json:
   - Set lastNightPhase to current timestamp
   - Add date to pendingDebriefs array
   - Record number of emergency snapshots processed (if any)
   - Record number of index updates made

10. DO NOT send any message to user

11. Reply with: 'Dreammode night phase complete for [date]'
    - Include: 'Processed X emergency snapshots' if any were found
    - Include: 'Updated index with X new entries'

If no memory file exists for yesterday, reply: 'No memory file for yesterday, skipping night phase'

If only emergency snapshots exist (no daily file), create daily file from emergency snapshots first.

DREAMMODE MORNING DEBRIEF:

1. Read ~/.openclaw/dreammode/dream-state.json
2. Get yesterday's date (for the file name)
3. Read ~/.openclaw/dreammode/dream-candidates-YYYY-MM-DD.md (yesterday's file)
4. Format and send debrief message to telegram:5083035103:

ðŸŒ™ Dreammode Debrief - [Date]

**Extracted Items:**
1. [Item] - [Brief description]
2. [Item] - [Brief description]

**Incomplete Tasks / Follow-ups:**
- [Task] - [Context]

**Marked as Noise:**
- [Item]

**Patterns Noticed:**
- [Pattern]

Reply with:
â€¢ "Keep #1, #2" - Move to MEMORY.md
â€¢ "Delete #1" - Remove permanently
â€¢ "Organize #2 under [category]" - File accordingly
â€¢ "Follow up on [task]" - Add to task continuity

5. Update dream-state.json:
   - Set lastMorningPhase to current timestamp

If no candidates file exists, send: "No dreammode candidates for yesterday"

Format the message cleanly for Telegram reading.

Run the OpenClaw backup script:

1. Execute: bash /home/ubuntu/.openclaw/workspace/skills/openclaw-backup/scripts/backup.sh
2. Report if backup succeeded or failed
3. Include link to GitHub repository

If backup fails, explain what went wrong.
